alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Lincoln; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 19 at 9:29PM CDT until September 19 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN SEMINOLE...SOUTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA...SOUTHERN LINCOLN...NORTHEASTERN CLEVELAND AND NORTHWESTERN POTTAWATOMIE COUNTIES... At 929 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Dale, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Oklahoma City, northeastern Norman, Shawnee, Seminole, Tecumseh, Choctaw, Harrah, McLoud, Pink, Meeker, Earlsboro, Johnson, Stella, Dale, Newalla, Bethel Acres, and Aydelotte. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
